Detailed Description

A two-dimensional point.

This class can be used to interchangeably represent either a point in two-dimensional space or a vector in two-dimensional space. It includes many of the functions that one would expect for such things, including addition, subtraction, scalar multiplication, dot product, unit vector calculation, and magnitude calculation.

Definition at line 55 of file point.h.

Point2::Point2 ( std::string  pointStr  ) 

Special constructor.

This constructor is only used in the Mesh class.

It takes in a string of a specific type, usually the type that is given in standard .obj files. This string is of the form "vn* n1 n2", where '*' is a character (or nothing), and n1, n2, are both doubles. If pointStr is not of the proper format, then it throws an error to the error class and sets loadError to true, then uses the default constructor.

Parameters:
pointStr is the string to turn into a point.

Definition at line 386 of file point.cpp.

00388     if (pointStr.size() > 0 && pointStr[0] == 'v') {     //This would indicate a .obj style vertex

00392             //printf("FoundThem...");

00394             y = b;
00395         } else {

00397             x = y = 0;
00398             loadError = true;
00399         }
00400     } else {    //This would indicate an error in formatting
00401         printf("Point2: Error, string format not recognized\n");
00402         loadError = true;

bool Point2::getLoadError (  ) 

Find out if there was a construction error.

If there was an error loading the point, as could occur when you load it from a string.

Returns:
If there was a load error, returns true. Else returns false.

double Point2::operator* ( const Point2 &  todot  ) 

Dot two vectors.

This function does not edit the value of *this.

double Point2::dot ( const Point2 &  a,
const Point2 &  b 
) [static]

Static function to dot two vectors.

The dot product is calculated as the traditional dot product of two vectors in two-dimensional space. This function is static because it is usually clearer to use Point2::dot(a,b) than to use a.dot(b).

Parameters:
a is the first vector to be dotted.
b is the second vector to be dotted.
Returns:
returns the dot product of a and b.

00526 {
00527         return a.x*b.x + a.y*b.y;

double Point2::getMagSquared (  ) 

Get the magnitued of this vector squared.

This function is useful because the square root function is relatively expensive. For comparison purposes, this works much faster.

This function does not edit the value of *this.

Returns:
returns the magnitude of this vector squared.

void Point2::doTex (  ) 

Peform a glTexCoord2f() call.

This function simply performs a glTexCoord2f() call with the values stored in the point.
